description: After a pick-up from your hotel in Sharm el-Sheikh, get your first look at the incredible landscape you'll explore further on this tour of the Sinai Peninsula. Enjoy a view of the natural colors and rock formations and stop at a little oasis to get a closer look. , ,Then ride along the coast on the back of a camel to the Blue Hole, a renowned spot for diving and snorkeling 10 kilometers north of Dahab on the east coast of the Sinai Peninsula on the Gulf of Aqaba. , ,Let the stress of the everyday float away as you immerse yourself in this relaxing environment. Enjoy incredible views from atop a camel and under the water; immerse yourself in this unique world and watch the countless colorful fish and vibrant coral reefs up close or relax on the sand in the sun. , ,During the tour, enjoy a delicious lunch. On the journey back, enjoy an opportunity to walk around Dahab and do a bit of shopping before returning to your hotel.
includes: Transfer to/from your hotel in an air-conditioned vehicle ,Tour guide ,Lunch ,Drink ,Camel ride
experiences: See the incredible landscape of the Sinai Desert with its rock formations on the way to the Blue Hole ,Learn more about the life of the desert denizens, visit a Bedouin cemetery and ride a camel ,Discover the vibrant underwater world or relax on the beach at the Blue Hole
title: Sharm el-Sheikh: Snorkel & Camel Safari at Blue Hole

description: Go on a fantastic underwater trip on the Sinbad Submarine and discover the marine life in the Red Sea on a 3-hour trip from Hurghada. , ,After you are picked up from your hotel, you will be transferred to the pier for boarding. The Sinbad Submarine seats 44 people and 2 pilots, and has windows specially constructed to maximize your underwater viewing. Once you head below the water, you will have approximately 50 minutes to enjoy the views of the Red Sea at a depth of 72 feet (22 meters) below the surface. , ,When you are done exploring the underwater ecosystem, the submarine will return you to the surface. You will then be transferred back to your hotel.
includes: All transfers by air-conditioned bus ,English-speaking Egyptologist guide ,Soft drinks ,Entrance fees
experiences: Take a trip in the Sinbad Submarine for an exciting excursion ,Enjoy incredible views of the underwater world of the Red Sea ,See life underwater for 50 minutes at a depth of 72 feet (22 meters)
title: 3-Hour Sinbad Submarine Red Sea Tour from Hurghada

description: Depart Hurghada to experience the surrounding desert from multiple perspectives on a combined Quad Bike drive, camel ride and visit to a Bedouin camp.  , Following pick-up at your hotel, journey to the Quad Bike park by air-conditioned vehicle. Upon arrival, take a test drive on the ATV (All Terrain Vehicle) to get used to how it drives. Each bike is equipped with automatic transmission to make it easy to operate; all you need to do is accelerate and brake! Once you feel confident on your bike, set off into the desert. , ,Journey for approximately 1 hour to a Bedouin camp, where you will be welcomed with traditional tea. Learn more about the Bedouin lifestyle, and get the chance to ride a camel. Climb back on your bike and drive back to base before traveling back to Hurghada for your hotel drop off.
includes: Pick-up and drop off service from Hurghada city ,Transfers to and from the quad bike park by air-conditioned vehicle ,Guide during the desert safari ,Test drive on the quad bike at the start of the safari ,Quad bike ride ,Camel ride in the desert ,Visit to a Bedouin village, including barbecue dinner ,Mineral water and soft drinks ,All taxes and service charges
experiences: Drive a Quad Bike across the desert sands surrounding Hurghada ,Visit a Bedouin camp and learn more about their lifestyle and culture ,Climb on the back of a camel to experience the landscape from a different perspective

description: Start your visit to Marsa Alam in style with a luxurious and private 15-minute transfer from the airport to your hotel. Travel from the Marsa Alam airport in a vehicle that has a capacity of to 8 people. , ,The tour provider s representative will be waiting for you in the arrivals area of the airport to meet and greet you, based on your time of arrival. , ,You ll be shown to your air-conditioned vehicle and you ll soon be on the way to your destination in comfort.

description: Listen to stories about the history of Egypt and learn about ancient Egyptian culture, all told by your expert guide. Travel to the Great Pyramids - one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Visit and enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. , ,The tour also includes many outstanding photo stops and a visit to the Valley Temple which belongs to the Pyramids of Chephren. This temple served for the purification of the mummy of the king before its burial. It was also used for the mummification process of the king. , ,Then you will visit the Solar Boat Museum next to the Great Pyramid of Cheops which includes the solar boats that were made out of cedar wood and they were used in religious rituals during the time of the Pharaohs. Then travel in comfort back to your hotel.
includes: Flexibility to customize your itinerary to your own preferences ,All transfers by modern air conditioned van from your hotel in Cairo ,Pickup services from your hotel and return ,Tour guide ,Entry inside the great pyramid ,Entry inside the Solar Boat Museum ,Entrance fees ,All service charges and taxes

description: Meet your guide in the lobby of your hotel and start your day. Hope into your car and rely on your guide to devote their full attention to you throughout the day. , ,On your way to your first stop, listen to your guide as they explain the sights you pass and the culture of the area. Transfer by modern air-conditioned vehicle to see the last 4 working monasteries of this once enveloped place. , For your first stop, visit Deir al-Baramus, the oldest monastery that you will see. Move on to Dier Anba Bishoi, whose body is still in the monastery. Proceed to Dier Abu Maqar, the richest of the monasteries, and end your trip as you visit Deir El-Suryani, the smallest and most compact of the 4 monasteries. Upon return to Alexandria, if you have time, stop to take some scenic photos. Travel in comfort back to your hotel in Alexandria.
includes: All transfers by air-conditioned vehicle ,Expert tour guide ,Entrance fees as per itinerary ,All service charges & taxes
experiences: Visit Deir al-Baramus, the oldest monastery of your tour ,Explore 4 traditional monasteries ,Join a professional local guide
title: Wadi El Natrun: Full-Day Monasteries Tour from Alexandria

description: At the Philae Sound and Light show, the Egyptian gods and goddesses are resurrected before your eyes to tell of their life stories. The myth of Isis and Osiris comes to life through dazzling lights and capturing music, with sounds from the deepest accounts of ancient history. Presenting the myth of Osiris, the goddess of death and his beloved wife Isis, who resurrected her husband using life rituals after being killed by his brother, Set, the God of Evil in ancient Egypt. , ,Discover  the temple and how it came to be called Philae, from the ancient Egyptian word Pilak, meaning  the remote place.  Learn about the enduring task to restore the temple from watery ruin.  , ,Enjoy the spectacular lights of the multimedia presentations which vividly reveals the form and majesty of this ancient site and walk through the magnificent temple as its history is narrated. A show for the family to appreciate, and old world skills and new world technologies come together for an evening. After the show transfer back to your hotel.
includes: Pick-up service from your hotel in Aswan and return ,Entrance fees to Sound & Light Show ,All transfers by a modern air-conditioned vehicle ,All service charges and taxes
experiences: Explore the ancient Philae Temple ,Immerse yourself in the ancient and the contemporary cultures of Aswan ,Enjoy a sound and light show suitable for the whole family
title: Sound and Light Show at Philae Temple

description: You will be picked up from your hotel in Portghalib or Marsa alam, It takes 30 minutes driving to Abo Dabab Bay. , ,Abo Dabab Bay is a beautiful snorkeling and dive site in the area of Marsa Alam. It has coral reefs with plenty of colorful fish, which you can see when snorkeling. , ,The bay has a sandy beach with sea grass and crystal clear, warm water. As well as hosting a great variety of colored fish, the Bay is also home to Green Turtles and the endangered Dugong that occasionally visit the sheltered bay to feed on the sea grass. Afterwards, return to your hotel.
includes: Day out on the beach ,Transfer from and to your hotel in Marsa alam ,Transportation by air-conditioned vehicle ,English-speaking guide ,Snorkeling equipment ,Service charges and taxes included
experiences: Swim with giant sea turtles and dugongs ( sea cows ) in Turtles Bay ,Marvel at the well-preserved coral of the coral gardens ,Get access to the beach ,Enjoy a tasty lunch on board

Snorkeling equipment and life jackets are provided and a professional guide will show you the best spots. , ,Enjoy the sunshine on the beach or swim with floating toys. Learn about belly dancing and wear belly dancing costumes. Take advantage of a 10 minutes massage and the free WiFi. Your kids can enjoy the kids' area with the animation team. There will be game competitions with prizes. Have a tasty lunch, served with a wonderful sea view.

description: Avoid the torment and stress of waiting for taxis by opting for this affordable airport transfer. Your skilled driver will be waiting for you at the airport with a name sign in the arrivals hall. From here they will help with your luggage before guiding you to your premium airport transfer. , For hotel pick-up, your driver will meet you at your hotel lobby. Please be ready and waiting 10 minutes before your designated meeting time. It is recommended to give your flight number in advance, so your driver can arrive at the appropriate time. If there happens to be a delay in your flight, your driver will be waiting until you arrive safely at no extra fee. , ,All drivers have excellent experience and a wealth of knowledge of the city. If you have any questions at any stage of your transfer, simply ask. Whether you d prefer music, talking or simply snoozing after a long journey, your driver will get you safely to the right destination.

description: You will drive in a modern, air-conditioned vehicle to Wadi El-Natrun, which is regarded as the  birthplace for monasticism . There were around 50 monasteries originally, but only 4 have survived until today. , ,Your tour will start with a visit to Deir al-Baramus, the oldest of the surviving 4 monasteries, and the most isolated one, before proceeding to Deir Anba Bishoi, home to the body of Saint Pishoy. , ,You will end your trip with a visit to Deir El-Suryani - a Coptic, orthodox monastery which is the smallest yet best-preserved monastery.
includes: All transfers by a private, air-conditioned vehicle ,Entrance fees to all the mentioned sites ,All service charges & taxes

description: Your guide will pick you up from your hotel to start your tour in Aswan. Your first stop is the High Dam, an engineering miracle built in 1960 to save Egypt from the flooding of the Nile. The Dam provides a huge water reservoir known as Lake Nasser, one of the biggest artificial lakes in the world. , ,Afterwards, you will get to visit the unfinished obelisk (the largest known ancient obelisk), and see how the ancient Egyptians used to cut them.  , Finally, you will get to sail along the Nile to visit the majestic Philae temple which was built in honor of the goddess Isis, the chief deity of the island. The temple is associated with various love story sagas.
includes: All transfers by a private, air-conditioned vehicle ,Private English-speaking Egyptologist ,Entrance fees to all mentioned sites ,Mineral water on-board the vehicle during the tour ,All service charges & taxes
experiences: Take a tour of Aswan and visit the High Dam ,Cruise the Nile and visit the Philae Temple ,Marvel at the work of the ancient Egyptians at the unfinished obelisk
title: Aswan Philae Temple, Obelisk and High Dam Tour

description: Enjoy a half-day tour of Hurghada and explore the biggest port resort of the Red Sea. While it lacks a long history or many spectacular buildings, as a tourist center it offers numerous activities and is definitely worth a look. , ,Get your first impressions by cruising the streets on board a high quality air-conditioned vehicle. Stop at the Coptic Church and Big Mosque. Then, it s time to enjoy some of the resort s legendary shops, will plenty of opportunities to purchase unique souvenirs, aromatic spices, or new items of clothing. Your guide will be on hand to help. , For the remaining 2.5 hours you have the choice to either continue shopping, find a nice cafe or restaurant for something to eat or drink, or take part in one of the optional activities (surcharge applies). Explore Egypt`s underwater flora and fauna without getting wet on board the Red Sea s only tourist submarine. Descend to a depth of 25 meters (84 feet) to see a variety of colorful fish. Alternatively, visit the Red Sea Aquarium, where an abundance of fish and other marine animals includes dolphins and turtles. , Finally, spend some time in the beautiful New Marina, Hurghada s luxury yacht harbor. Pop into the upscale shops, enjoy a refreshing drink in a cafe, or just promenade along the sea front.
includes: Transfers from/to your hotel in Hurghada by high quality air-conditioned vehicles ,Guide
experiences: Explore the Red Sea's most famous resort town ,Enjoy an orientation tour of Hurghada's Big Mosque and Coptic Church ,Discover the boutique gift stores of Hurghada ,Visit the New Marina to promenade on the sea front ,Choose  2 optional activities to explore the marine life of the Red Sea
title: Discover Mosque, Church and Harbor with Local Guide

description: This 4-day luxury cruise from Aswan to Luxor on the Nile River is the perfect way to see many of the most important archaeological sites of Egypt. Visit the Valley of the Kings at Luxor, take in the splendors of the Kom Ombo Temple and see the Necropolis of Thebes. , ,Your luxury boat will serve lunch and dinner throughout the cruise and you can dance the night away to an on board disco. Relax by the sundeck and swimming pool, or seek out the services of an Egyptologist guide to learn more about Ancient Egypt. , ,Day 1: Departure from Aswan (Monday, Wednesday, or Friday) ,On arrival in Aswan, meet your local tour representative for the start of your tour. Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple. Then, board your cruise in Aswan. Enjoy lunch on board, as well as afternoon tea, dinner and an evening disco party. , ,Day 2: Kom Ombo   Edfu - Luxor ,Enjoy breakfast on board your cruise boat. Then, set sail to visit the Kom Ombo Temple, dedicated to the crocodile-god Sobek, and the falcon-god Haroeris. Located on a bend in the Nile, it is said that in ancient times, sacred crocodiles would bask in the sun on the banks of the area. , ,Sail to Edfu, site of the Ptolemaic Temple of Horus. After lunch, visit the temple and ancient settlement, known in Roman times as Apollin polis. Cross the lock and sail to Luxor, enjoying an on board dinner and overnight stay. , ,Day 3: Luxor ,After breakfast on board, cross the Nile to the West Bank to tour the Necropolis of Thebes, Valley of The Kings, Temple of Hatshepsut, and the Colossi of Memnon. , ,Luxor has often been called the world's greatest open-air museum and the number of preserved monuments are unparalleled anywhere else in the world. Focusing on the West Bank, you will stroll around the ruins at the Valley of the Kings and Valley of the Queens, used primarily for the burials of Pharaohs. Admire the massive stone statues of the Colossi of Memnon and the mortuary temples of the Temple of Hatshepsut. , ,Return to your boat for afternoon tea and relax on board, soaking up the sun by the swimming pool. Enjoy dinner and a last overnight stay on board. , ,Day 4: Luxor - Departure ,After breakfast, visit the East Bank of Luxor to see Luxor Temple, built by Amenhotep III from Nubian sandstone. You will also visit the other great monument of the East Bank, Karnak Temple, said to be the 2nd most visited site in Egypt after the Pyramids of Giza. , ,Transfer to Luxor Train Station, Luxor Airport, or a Luxor hotel for the end of the tour and your final departure.
includes: 3 nights cruise boat accommodation (full board) ,Transportation by air-conditioned vehicles ,English-speaking tour guide
experiences: Relax on a 3-night Nile River cruise on board a floating hotel, with sundeck, swimming pool and full-service meals ,Enjoy the on board evening entertainment, such as a belly dance show, Captain's welcome cocktail party, Nubian folk show, and more ,Take a tour of the Valley of the Kings and learn about the burials of Pharaohs ,Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple ,Cross to the West Bank to visit the Necropolis of Thebes and Temple of Hatshepsut ,Admire the massive stone statues of the Colossi of Memnon ,Explore the East Bank of Luxor, said to be the 2nd most visited site in Egypt after the Pyramids of Giza
title: 4-Day Nile Cruise from Aswan to Luxor

description: Visit one of the Seven Wonders of the Old World, the oldest one actually, and the only one that still remains. The Three Pyramids of Giza: Khufu, Khafre and Menkaure have preserved the past for about 5000 years and the time is coming to explore the long-vanished world. , ,Look at the 2.3 million stones of the Great Pyramid which was once a burial site for the Egyptian Pharaoh in the bygone era. Now the decorated tomb, the red granite sarcophagus and the elaborate wall paintings do not illustrate how Egyptians died but how they lived. A few miles away from the necropolis area, you can find the 5000 year-old limestone structure of the silent, mysterious Sphinx with a lion s body and a Pharaoh s head belonging to the King Khefre.
includes: All transfers in an air-conditioned vehicle ,Port pick-up & drop off ,Private tour guide (if option selected) ,Entrance fees ,Lunch (if option selected)
experiences: Travel in comfort with transfer from your Hotel ,Marvel at the Three Pyramids of Giza ,Discover the majestic Sphinx
title: Cheops Pyramids with Transfer and Options

description: Once you arrive at the Egyptian Museum of Antiquities, which is located in Tahrir square, you'll find a representative who will give you your tickets. Or, if you've selected a transportation option, be picked up from your hotel in downtown Cairo or Giza and taken to the museum in a comfortable air-conditioned bus. Then you'll be ready to explore the fascinating exhibitions that will teach you all about Egypt's past, and in fact show you rare and unique items from each era of the country's history. , ,Constructed in 1902, this is the largest museum in the region and houses 250,000 rare artifacts of all sizes. The ground floor contains the large heavy statues arranged in chronological order. Then take a tour of the upper floor to see the smaller statues, fossils, paintings, sarcophagi and ancient Egyptian maps. Be sure to visit the exclusive section dedicated to Tutankhamun to see all his treasures, which were discovered in his tomb in Luxor, including his golden mask. Be sure to set aside the whole day to cover the vast expanses of time and space that this museum covers!
includes: Entrance ticket to the museum ,Pick-up and drop off from hotel only if option is selected upon booking
experiences: Explore tbe two huge levels of the Egyptian Museum ,Marvel at Tutankhamun's exclusive section in the museum ,See statues, fossils, paintings, and more!
title: Egyptian Museum of Antiquities Entrance Ticket

description: At 6:00 you will be picked up from your hotel in Aswan or from Aswan Airport, met and assisted by a local representatives before being transferred to the cruise. Boarding will be before lunch, then begin your day tour in Aswan Visiting the High Dam and the Philae temple around 13:00 pm the cruise Sail to Kom Ombo. Have lunch on board followed by afternoon tea, then visit the temple shared by the two gods Sobek and Haroeris. , ,Dinner is on on board, followed by a disco party. Overnight you'll go past in Edfu. On day two, visit the Temple of Horus in Edfu, cross the lock and sail to Luxor. Afternoon Tea, Dinner on board & Galabya party. On day three, cross to the West Bank to visit Valley of the Kings, the Temple of Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. You'll enjoy an excursion to the Valley of Kings, a visit to the tombs of various dynasties and the Temple of Deir El Bahari. On the return journey, stop at the Colossi of Memnon where you'll find two gigantic sitting statues, representing Amenophis III, facing the Nile. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut and return for lunch on board and an afternoon spent at your leisure. Disembark on day four and begin your tour of the east bank, with Karnak and Luxor Temples. The excursion to the Luxor Temple will bring you to its courtyard and the granite statues of Ramses the Great. Proceed by carriage or bus to Karnak, which is a series of temples built in different reigns. , Finally, start by the Avenue of Sphinxes and visit the Unfinished Propylon, the Hypostyle Hall with its 134 gigantic columns, the Obelisks of Queen Hatshepsut and Tutomosis III, the temple of Amon adorned with lotus and papyrus designs, the Granite Scarbeus of Amenophis III and the Sacred Lake. You'll be transferred to the airport at the end of your tour.
includes: Pick-up service from your hotel in Aswan to The Nile Cruise ,Multilingual expert Egyptologist guide ,3 Night accommodation on Full Board Basis Starting with Lunch ,All transfers by a modern air-conditioned vehicle ,Sightseeing as Per Tour Itinerary ,All service charges and taxes ,All transfers in Luxor, and Aswan
experiences: Visit the temple shared by the two gods Sobek and Haroeris. ,See The Temple of Horus in Edfu and cross the lock ,Discover the Valley of the Kings, the Temple of Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. ,Explore The East Bank: Karnak and LuxorTemples
title: Budget Egypt Nile Cruise from Aswan to Luxor

description: Your tour guide will pick you up from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh and take you to the Bedouin village for a traditional dinner and to witness their daily life activities and traditions. , ,Then, you will have a chance to ride a camel - a classic Egyptian experience. You will also be able to witness the amazing panoramic views of the desert and sunset. , Finally, you will have a barbecue dinner and enjoy an oriental show including folkloric songs before being driven back to your hotel.

description: Travel in comfort with an expert guide to see the town of El Alamein. Learn about Rommel, the Desert Fox, and other figures of World War 2 who fought in Egypt and their significance in the war. Ask any questions you have as you talk with an expert on the subject. , ,On site visit an enlightening local war museum, which tells the story of El Alamein through war memorabilia. The gardens outside of the museum are scattered with huge army tanks and large scale weaponry that were used during the battles of El Alamein. Inside there are five halls, each dedicated to a country involved in the war, with uniforms, weapons, models and records on display.  , ,Continue your way to the beautiful town of El Alamein overlooking the Mediterranean sea. Pay your respects and visit the World War Cemeteries, the final resting place for so many Greek, Italian and German soldiers.
includes: All transfers by air-conditioned vehicle ,Expert tour guide ,Entrance fees ,All Service charges and taxes
experiences: Learn about this important part of World War 2 from an expert on the subject ,Visit the picturesque town of El Alamein right on the Mediterranean sea ,Look at the memorabilia and weaponry used in battle, see a piece of history
title: From Alexandria: El Alamein Day Tour

description: Meet your tour guide at your hotel lobby, and benefit from his or her full attention from the word go. Head out from your hotel in Cairo to visit the Great Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Visit The Great Sphinx, and make use of many outstanding photo stops. , ,Enjoy a visit to the Valley Temple, which belongs to the Pyramids of Chephren, and served for the purification of the mummy of the king before its burial. After that, move on to visit The Egyptian Museum, with more than 250,000 pieces on display, including a rare collection of Egyptian art from over 5,000 years. Explore the Tutankhamen room and its treasure, jewelry and gold, enclosed in his tomb for over 3500 years before it was discovered in 1920 during excavation. Finally, travel in comfort back to your hotel.
includes: All transfers by modern air-conditioned vehicle ,Tour guide ,Entrance fees ,All service charges and taxes ,Mummy room
experiences: Visit the Egyptian Museum ,Uncover the Tut Anch Amun Treasures ,Wander around the curious Mummies room ,See the Great Pyramids

description: Day one: Luxor East Bank with Lunch and Dinner ,Begin your adventure with a pickup from your accommodation in Luxor or at Luxor airport, bus, or train station. Be transferred to your cruise to check in and freshen up. Later, your friendly guide will accompany you for a visit to the East Bank of the Nile, taking in the Temple of Karnak, the Temple of Luxor, and the Obelisk of Ramses II.  , ,Day two: Luxor West Bank with Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner ,Enjoy breakfast on board. Cross to the West Bank to visit the Valley of the Kings. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari. See the Colossi of Memnon and visit an alabaster institute. Enjoy an afternoon tea when start sailing towards Kom Ombo temple.  , ,Day three: Kom Ombo to Edfu with Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner ,After breakfast, visit the Temple of Kom Ombo. Sail to Edfu. After lunch, visit the Temple of Horus. Cross Esna Lock and sail to Aswan. , ,Day four: Aswan with Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner ,Arrive in Aswan and visit the High Dam and Philae Temple. Return to the cruise ship then enjoy your free time. Lunch and afternoon tea will be served on board.  , ,Day five: Aswan with Breakfast ,After breakfast, check out and be transferred to your accommodation in Aswan or Aswan airport, bus, or train station.

description: You will be picked up from your hotel in Sharm el Sheikh at 7:00 PM and then drive for about 2 hours from Sharm to Moses Mountain in a coach. , ,On arrival you will start the ascent to the top of Mount Sinai. Reaching 2,285 meters, the climb includes about 750 steps, and will take you through the night to finish. On reaching the summit, gaze in awe as the sun rises, flooding the mountain with light. , ,After seeing the sunrise, you'll descend to St. Catherine's Monastery for breakfast. Saint Catherine's Monastery is on the Sinai Peninsula, at the mouth of a gorge at the foot of Mount Sinai in the city of Saint Catherine in Egypt. The monastery is Orthodox and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. , ,This monastery is one of the oldest working Christian monasteries in the world together with the Monastery of Saint Anthony, situated across the Red Sea in the desert south of Cairo, which also lays claim to that title. , ,After visiting this incredible ancient site, you will leave for Sharm El Sheikh, and arrive in Sharm at about 1:00 PM, enjoying a transfer you back to your hotel.
includes: Pick-up/drop-off services from/to your hotel in Sharm ,All transfers by a modern air-conditioned vehicle ,Entrance fees ,Breakfast and Drinks
experiences: Visit Saint Catherine's Monastery, one of the oldest in the world, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site ,Ascend the same mountain as Moses, in an overnight climb ,Watch the sun rise from the summit of Mount Sinai ,Eat breakfast at St. Catherine's Monastery after your epic climb

description: Take a 4-day luxury Nile cruise and admire the beauty of the Nile River Valley. See the important sites in Luxor, including the Karnak Temple, Temple of Queen Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. In Aswan, you ll visit the Philae temple and the High Dam. Travel by VIP first-class train between Cairo and Aswan. , ,Detailed Itinerary ,Day 1 ,Transfer to the Cairo train station to catch the overnight train to Aswan. , ,Day 2: Aswan   Kom Ombo (Meals: Lunch, Dinner) ,Arrival in Aswan, where you ll meet your tour representative at the train station. Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple before transferring to the cruise ship. Lunch and afternoon tea will be served on board. Sail to Kom Ombo. Dinner and overnight on board. , ,Day 3: Kom Ombo   Edfu   Luxor (Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) ,After breakfast, visit the Temple of Kom Ombo. Sail to Edfu. After lunch, visit the Temple of Horus. Cross Esna Lock and sail to Luxor. Overnight on board. , ,Day 4: Luxor West Bank (Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) ,Breakfast on board. Cross to the West Bank to visit the Valley of the Kings. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari. See the Colossi of Memnon and visit an alabaster institute. Afternoon tea and dinner and overnight on board. , ,Day 5: Luxor East Bank (Meals: Breakfast) ,Breakfast on board before disembarkation from the cruise ship. Visit the East Bank of the Nile, taking in the Temple of Karnak, the Temple of Luxor, and the Obelisk of Ramses II. Transfer to the train station to catch the overnight train back to Cairo. , ,Day 6 ,Arrival in Cairo and transfer to your hotel.

description: Depart Aswan to journey 280 kilometers to the stunning rock-carved temples of Abu Simbel. Relocated to the west banks of Lake Nasser, the temple complex is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the  Nubian Monuments.  , ,On arrival, take a short walk to the temple entrance, where your Egyptologist guide will explain the history of the site. Hear details of the UNESCO-led relocation of the entire cliff face to higher ground, and how the temples were only discovered by accident in 1813. , ,Due to the large number of visitors, guides are not permitted inside the Great Temple of Ramses II or the smaller Temple of Hathor. However, by using photos and illustrations your guide will explain the structures and their interior artworks before giving you some free time to enter the temples and explore at leisure. , ,As one of the few Ancient Egyptian sites that largely escaped damage from past invaders, the interiors of the Abu Simbel temples are astounding. The scale of the buildings and their detailed decorations leave most visitors in awe. The experience is further enhanced by the scenic location on the edge of Lake Nasser in the orange sands of the desert. , ,After visiting the temples, benefit from some time for a short visit to the small visitor's center to see documents relating to the UNESCO relocation project (time permitting) before the drive back to Aswan.
includes: Return transportation from and to your hotel or Nile cruise ship in Aswan ,All the transfers and tours in modern air-conditioned vehicle ,Qualified tour guide in language of your choice ,Bottle of water for each participant ,All service charges and taxes
experiences: Explore the best temples ever for King Ramses and his wife Nefertari ,Marvel the most amazing scenes inside the temples ,Enjoy personalized attention from an Egyptologist guide ,See the stunning rock-hewn temples of Abu Simbel on the banks of Lake Nasser ,Benefit from some free time to explore at your leisure
title: Aswan: Full-Day Private Tour to Abu Simbel Temples

description: Spend two days exploring Cairo and Giza on a private tour with an Egyptologist as your guide. Visit old Islamic and Coptic Cairo, explore the Egyptian Museum, and see the Giza Pyramids and Sphinx. , ,Day 1 ,Explore old Islamic and Coptic Cairo with a guide. Visit the Hanging church, the Coptic Museum, and Ben Ezra Synagogue. See the Citadel of Saladin before stopping for lunch. Enjoy a walk along Khan El Khalili Street and experience a traditional Egyptian market. , ,Day 2 ,Start your day with a visit to the Egyptian Museum with your guide. Home to 165,000 Egyptian artifacts, the priceless treasures of King Tutankhamen are the highlight of the museum. Choose to visit the Mummies Hall for an additional fee. Sail along the Nile on a small boat and take in the sights or enjoy lunch at a restaurant by the Nile River. , ,Visit the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx. The sphinx is an enigmatic symbol of Egypt. Enter one of the Pyramids (for an additional fee) if you wish. You ll have the opportunity to do some shopping and visit a perfume factory and a traditional papyrus institute as well.
includes: Entrance to sites mentioned in the program ,Local taxes ,Lunch on both days ,Private Egyptologist guide ,Private hotel pickup and drop-off ,Private tour ,Transportation by private vehicle

description: Enjoy a pick-up service, avoid the crowded roads and travel to the Pyramids of Giza. If you are staying in Cairo, it is only a short drive before the Pyramids of Giza are in view. Your bus will park as close as possible. Watch the oldest wonder of the Old World and  the only that still remains. The three pyramids of Giza; Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos have not been affected by time or natural catastrophes. , ,Your next stop is the Egyptian Museum, home to more than 120,000 rare artifacts from the Three Kingdoms. Here, you have two full floors with 107 halls to visit. While the ground floor holds large statutes, the second contains  small statues, jewelry, papyrus, the mummies and the world s most extensive collection of the boy King, Tutankhamun. Take your time discovering his shining items and discover all that the museum has to offer.
includes: Hotel pick-up and drop off service ,All transfers in an air-conditioned bus ,Entrance fees to all the attractions mentioned in the itinerary
experiences: Visit the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx ,Enjoy a tour at the two-floor Egyptian Museum ,Learn about ancient Egypt's boy-king Tutankhamun and visit his collection inside the museum

description: If you are lucky enough to be staying in Cairo then you are only a short while from the Three Pyramids of Giza. On arrival, your bus will park as close as possible. Discover the oldest wonder of the Old World and marvel at the Pyramids of Giza. All 3 of which have not been affected by time or natural catastrophes. , ,Take photos of the incredible pyramid with an estimated total of 2,300,000 stone blocks. Beside it you will meet the eyes of a sculpture formed of lion s body and Pharaoh s head which belonged to King Chephren. It is the mysterious Sphinx. Then, you will be transferred to Sakkara, home of the Step Pyramid of Szoser. After that, you head towards Memphis, the ancient capital city of old Egypt, before enjoying a final visit to Dahshur. After your tour you will be dropped back to your hotel.

description: Begin by visiting Sakkara and the Step Pyramid of Djoser, which dates back to 2600 BC under the 3rd Dynasty. It is considered the oldest stone structure and it was built for king Djoser. , ,Proceed to visit Memphis, which was the first capital city of Old Egypt, and see the Statue of Ramses II at Memphis. On your way to the south you will visit the Red Pyramid and the Bent Pyramid of Dahshur , ,Travel in comfort back to your hotel. Cairo has so much to see, feel, eat and buy, so if you have time and want to add more to your itinerary, let the local operator know if there is anything you would like to add to your itinerary.

Enjoy an all-inclusive tour that provides you with the equipment you need, along with food and drinks to stay refreshed. , ,In the morning, you'll be picked up from your hotel and transferred to the jetty. After boarding, set out on the water. Take in the nature and the beauty of the small islands you pass by. Eventually you will drop anchor and have time to go fishing. You will also be able to swim, snorkel, or scuba dive. , ,At lunchtime, dine on an open buffet lunch of fresh seafood. description: Explore Cairo at night while sailing in a traditional felucca wooden sailing boat, and have a guided city tour in an air-conditioned car in Cairo. Join us and don't miss this exciting tour! , ,Relish the feeling of discovering the sights in Cairo at night by a traditional felucca sailing boat on the River Nile. Discover the charming night life of Cairo. Cairo is very alive at night and offers you many possibilities to have a great evening. Depending on whether you prefer to explore the nightlife or enjoy sailing, you can also admire the beautiful sunset. , ,If you have a special occasion, such as a birthday, you can have your party arranged while sailing across the Nile. Feel the charm of the Egyptian Nile and the atmosphere of Cairo.

experiences: Explore the sights in Cairo at night ,Enjoy sailing on the River Nile aboard a traditional felucca wooden sailing boat ,Admire the beautiful sunset and experience Cairo s nightlife

description: Your guide will pick you up from your hotel to spend the evening enjoying the Sound and Light Show at Philae Temple. Watch in awe as a rainbow of lights and laser projections illuminates the temple, bringing it to stunning life. Walk through the atmospherically lit courts, halls and colonnades, as the English commentary summons up the ghosts of pharaohs past and recounts the temple s history through the ages. , ,Discover the symbolic meanings behind the wall reliefs and admire the lights of the floodlit edifice reflected in the lapping Nile waters. After the show, return to your private vehicle and travel directly back to your hotel or cruise ship, where your tour ends.

description: See historic monuments and the most popular tourist attractions of Egypt in miniature at the Mini Egypt Park open-air museum. Journey through the history of Egypt as you encounter scale models of iconic structures such as the pyramids and Great Sphinx of Giza and Basilica Church of Heliopolis. , ,Get the chance to walk from Cairo to Luxor in just a few steps as you stroll amongst the collection of 60 works of art. Learn the story of how Mini Egypt Park came to life as you encounter models of the Abu Simbel Temple, Aswan High Dam, Temple of Edfu and more.

description: Explore fantastic Cairo on this day trip from Marsa Alam to the Pyramids. You will be picked up from your hotel in Marsa Alam and taken to Hurghada Airport. From there you will fly to Cairo, where you will be picked up and accompanied by your guide. , ,Your Egyptologist tour guide will take you on a visit to the Great Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Then go to take memorable photos and to see the Sphinx with its lion body and the head of a pharaoh - the statue dates back to the reign of King Chephren. , ,You will have lunch at a local restaurant in Cairo. After that you will have the opportunity to visit the Egyptian Museum with all its treasures from the times of the Pharaohs. It displays more than 250,000 real artifacts, including Tut Ankh Amun's treasure collection. Continue to Cairo, where you will have the opportunity to visit Khan El Khalili, Cairo's oldest bazaar. , ,In the evening you will be transferred back to the airport and fly to Hurghada. There will be a vehicle waiting for you upon arrival, which will take you back to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

description: Travel around the Red Sea in style on this luxury, adult-only cruise around the Hurghada. Explore the underwater world as you snorkel alongside some of the most impressive coral reefs with the guidance of expert crew and discover the secrets of the sea as you swim around the home of stripy angel fish, sea turtles and rays. , ,Take a small break from snorkeling to enjoy a lavish buffet with a selection of seafood, BBQ, and a wide choice of salads, all cooked to the traditional Egyptian recipes. , ,Relax onboard and catch a tan on deck, make sure you choose the perfect sunbathing spot to keep a watchful eye out for dolphins, then treat yourself to an onboard back massage and release any stress you might be carrying around.

description: Meet your guide at your accommodation in Marsa Alam and head to Wadi El Gemal, which is 45 kilometers from South Marsa Alam. Wadi El Gemal includes many different ecological habitats and a variety of animal and bird species, including several endangered species. , ,Along the way, visit the landscape and ruins and then drive through the Wadi. The shores of Wadi El Gemal are heterogeneous in nature and include rocky, sandy, and muddy beaches. After that, visit Cleopatra Temple then discover the acacia and arak trees. , ,The park's coastline is about 120 kilometers and has several important landmarks including the headlands of Ras Baghdadi and Ras Honkorab, el Qulaan. You can enjoy the sunset, see an amazing snake show, and have dinner with the Bedouins of the region. Then sing and dance with the Bedouins. At the end of your Wadi El Gemal tour, you will be transferred back to your accommodation.
includes: Pick up and drop-off in a 4WD vehicle ,Tour guide ,Entrance fees ,Dinner with the Bedouins ,All taxes and service fees
experiences: Explore the Wadi El Gemal National Park with the Bedouins ,See wild dromedary herds and with a little luck also the offspring ,Drive through the wadi with your knowledgeable Bedouin

description: Treat yourself to a private transfer from Hurghada International Airport to Soma Bay. Spare yourself the hassle of searching for a taxi and negotiating prices with the driver, and reach your destination comfortably and on time. You can book a private limousine or van to quickly reach Soma Bay. , ,Your driver will meet you at the airport and will be holding a sign with your name written on it. Get in the air-conditioned vehicle and start your vacation comfortably and stress-free as your driver takes you to your hotel. You can determine the speed of the drive. Along the way you will gain a first impression of the wonderful vacation destination of Egypt.

description: Explore Giftun Island and spend the day snorkeling in the Red Sea. , ,After an initial safety briefing, set off toward the Giftun Islands, ready to explore the underwater world of corals and colorful fish, not to mention dolphins. The snorkeling tour is led by a professional guide for your utmost safety and enjoyment in the water. , ,Stop off at 3 different locations to snorkel, before enjoying lunch onboard your boat. Relax and soak up the sun on the plush sundeck, while taking in the spectacular surroundings of the Giftun Islands. , ,As your snorkeling adventure draws to a close, enjoy a quick transfer back to your hotel.

description: Start your day trip to the Great Pyramids, Memphis, and Sakkara, with an 08:00 pick-up at your hotel. Your guide will take you to the Giza Plateau where you will see the famous Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus. , ,Next, see the Great Sphinx statue and visit the Valley Temple, which is a part of the same ancient complex. Marvel at the ancient structure as you learn about the burial rites of the Pharaoh kings. , ,The next stop on your day tour is the Step Pyramid of King Djoser, at the fascinating Sakkara archeological site. Built in the 3rd Dynasty (around 2630 B.C.E.), this special pyramid is the world's oldest major stone structure. , From the Step Pyramids transfer to Memphis, the former capital city of ancient Egypt during the Old Kingdom. Having once reigned as a cultural center for over 3,000 years, Memphis offers stunning ancient sites and intrigue.
includes: Hotel pick-up and drop-off ,All transfers by a modern air-conditioned vehicle ,Entrance fees to the mentioned historical sites ,Egyptologist guide ,1 bottle of mineral water
experiences: Marvel at the famous Great Pyramids of Egypt at the Giza Plateau with your Egyptologist guide ,Explore the Valley Temple and the Ancient Sphinx, and wonder at the ancient rites of mummification ,See the ancient Step Pyramid of Djoser in the Sakkara archeological site as you learn about the evolution of pyramid design ,Visit Egypt's former capital of Memphis, once the cultural center of the ancient world

description: Be met outside your cruise ship by a tour representative and board an air-conditioned, private vehicle for the trip to Cairo, to enjoy a sightseeing tour of the Islamic and Coptic sites of the old city. , ,On this full-day excursion, your guide will take you to the Salah al-Din Citadel. Admire the Alabaster Mosque and also the Al-Gawhara Palace, which was built by Mohammed Ali Pasha in 1814. Visit El Moez Street to see the most beautiful examples of Islamic architecture. , ,Then proceed to Coptic Cairo to visit the the Hanging church, also known as the Al Mo'allaka Church, to see Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church, which sheltered the holy family, and visit Ben Ezra Synagogue. , ,You can take a break for lunch any time you like during the tour.
includes: Meet and greet service at Alexandria port ,All transfers by private air-conditioned vehicle ,Entrance fees to the sites in Cairo mentioned in the description ,Academic Egyptologist guide ,Lunch at a good Cairo restaurant ,Mineral water and soft drinks on board the vehicle ,Service charges and taxes
experiences: Visit the Citadel of Salah al-Din and the Alabaster Mosque ,Explore the shops in the Khan el-Khalili Bazaar ,See the Hanging Church, one of the oldest churches in Egypt

description: First, you will be picked up from your hotel before visiting the Catacombs of Kom El Shokafa which are the largest Roman Cemetery. Then, visit the Roman Amphitheater of Alexandria with the display of the sunken monuments. Drive by Pompay s Pillar and stop for a photo. , ,Your next stop is the library of Alexandria; the biggest library in the world. Visit its open court, manuscripts museum, president Saddat Museum, and the impressions of Alexandria Museum. , ,Afterwards, visit the church of St. Mark   the oldest church in Africa as well as the Abbo Elabbas Mosque. Continue to see the outside of Quaitbay castle which was built on the same site as the ancient Lighthouse. , ,Then, visit the gardens of Montaza and the royal gardens of King Farouk. See the royal palaces of Haramlek and Salamlek, and finally, walk along the famous Montaza bridge.
includes: Entrance fees ,All transfers by air-conditioned vehicle ,Expert tour guide ,All Service charges & taxes
experiences: Visit the Catacombs of Kom El Shokafa ,See the Roman Amphitheater & The Library of Alexandria Manuscripts museum ,Stop for a photo at Pompay's Pillar ,Visit the oldest church in Africa ,See the site of the Lighthouse, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World ,Walk across Stanley Bridge

description: The White Canyon, a splendid example of eroded sandstone, its floor awash with white powdered sand. It s narrow, winding path opens up to plateaus of harsh desert and then narrows again, until the exit at the oasis of Ain Khudra. It s beautiful place with date palms and water springs which has been home to Bedouin tribes for over one thousand years. , ,In the Sinai desert you can find an unusual formation made by sand and wind that looks like a mushroom so named Mushroom Rock. , ,We start at 08:00 AM from Dahab drive by jeep to White Canyon. There we have 1 hour for walking. We visit Ain Khudra Oasis, drink bedouin tea there. ,Then we drive for 40 min to see the Mushroom Rock. We stay there about 20 min. Then you will have lunch in Bedouin Village. ,After lunch we go walking for 1 hour  throw  Salama Canyon. Then we drive for 20 min to the Inscription Rock. We return to Dahab at 04:00 PM.
includes: Guide ,Lunch ,Bedouin tea ,Transportation on Land Cruiser
experiences: Explore the unique natural spectacle in the Sinai desert ,See The Mushroom Rock ,Lunch in Bedouin village.
title: One Day Jeep Safari From Dahab

description: Explore the underwater world of the Red Sea on a full-day diving tour from Sharm El-Sheikh. Following a meet up with your guide, who will provide all necessary equipment, you will enjoy a local dive to get orientated, before heading to the Lara wreck, Jackson Reef, and the Sinai Peninsula. , ,You can receive instruction tailored for beginners, and for those with more experience. Depending on your skill level, swim through schools of fish to a spot where sharks often gather. Proceed toward the wreck Yolanda to reach a plateau 15-25 meters (50-80 feet) deep, scattered with small ergs and coral outcrops where stone fish and scorpion fish feed. The wreck of the Yolanda, complete with its cargo of toilets and baths, provides home to big fish, such as tuna, bluefish, and the occasional hammerhead. , ,Another popular dive site is Jackson Reef on the northernmost of the 4 reefs that separate the Sinai and Saudi Arabia. Strong currents make it ideal for large pelagic, sharks and other big fish. Admire soft and hard coral, and look for barracudas, jacks, hammerheads, and tiger sharks. , ,The remains of the Cypriot merchant ship Lara, which collided with the reef in 1981, lies at depths of 45 meters (147 feet) and more, while the wreck of the SS Thistlegorm holds World War II machinery and equipment, still neatly stowed in its open holds, making for a fantastic dive experience. , ,This most famous Sinai Peninsula dive has to be experienced to truly appreciate its wonders. The group of coral heads at Temple come up from a depth of 12-20 meters (40-65 feet). If viewed in the right position, and using your imagination, they look like columns of a temple. , For a less challenging dive, there are sandy patches at about 8 meters (25 feet) with lots of inlets into the shore reefs, and coral heads about 2 meters (6.5 feet) apart, allowing you to swim between them.
includes: Transfer from/to hotel in Sharm El-Sheikh ,Lunch and soft drinks ,All diving equipment
experiences: Scuba dive at some of the best dive sites in the Red Sea ,Discover old shipwrecks that provide shelter to hundreds of fish, including big fish like tune ,Tailor the dive experience to suit your skill level ,See the Lara wreck, and the wreck of SS Thistlegorm, where World War II equipment is still stored ,Admire the soft and hard coral of Jackson Reef ,Dive among sharks, large pelagic and the occasional hammerhead ,Enjoy the shallow swim throughs and sandy patches
title: Sharm El-Sheikh Full-Day Scuba Diving Tour

description: Not everyone is a water sports person, so this trip, created for families with children and perhaps the not so active elderly family members, is great for families to enjoy some time together at sea in a comfortable and educational setting. , ,You will be picked up from your hotel at 11.00 or 15.00, and will drive for around 10 minutes to the glass bottom boat dock.  You will take a 1.5 hour trip in the glass bottomed boat to see Napoleon Reef, The Islands and Lagoon Reef. , ,If you decide you want to up the ante and dive into an adventure, there is the chance to snorkel if you wish. After the trip, you will be driven back to your hotel.

description: Avoid the torment and stress of waiting for taxis by opting for this affordable airport transfer. From here they will help with your luggage before guiding you to your premium airport transfer. , For hotel pick-up, your driver will meet you at your hotel lobby. Please be ready and waiting 10 minutes before your designated meeting time. It is recommended to give your flight number in advance, so your driver can arrive at the appropriate time. If there happens to be a delay in your flight, your driver will be waiting until you arrive safely at no extra fee. , ,All drivers have excellent experience and a wealth of knowledge of the city. description: Your day excursion to Cairo will start with your tour guide waiting for you at the lobby of your hotel in Alexandria. From the moment your tour starts, your guides will give you full attention. In the car on the way to the first attraction, your guide will tell you all about what you are seeing outside the windows as well as other aspects of the tour to come that might interest you. Your day in Cairo has been designed to give you the best overview of the city s most amazing monuments in just one day. ,  ,Travel first to the Great Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. description: From the moment your tour starts, your guide will give you their full attention. Once in the car, your guide will talk to you about all the things on the way as well as other aspects of your tour that will interest you. , ,Drive for 60 km to see the simple life of Rosetta and start your day trip to Rosetta from Alexandria. Upon your arrival you will take a motor boat on the Nile where you will see the meeting point of the Nile and the Mediterranean and see the castle where the Rosetta Stone was found in 1799. , ,After that you will see a lot of Islamic monuments. There is a huge variety of fish species, colorful corals, and various sea plants. It looks like an enormous aquarium but this is the real natural world. description: Start your tour with hotel pickup, and enjoy a transfer to starting point of your adventure. There you will receive all the necessary information about the excursion, as well as a brief dune buggy training session. ,  ,During the 45-kilometer round-trip dune buggy adventure, you'll drive through the dunes of the Red Sea Mountains to enjoy the beauty of Sahara desert. description: Start your experience with a pickup from your centrally located Hurghada hotel. Then, travel by comfortable minivan to the Hurghada Marina Yacht Club where your speedboat awaits. Complimentary water and soft drink are available on this intimate small-group cruise, limited to 6 people only. , Feel the coastal breeze as the boat picks up speed, reaching over 40 miles (64 km) per hour, so it s an exhilarating feeling. Two snorkeling stops are included on the tour around the nearest island to the marina where you can see coral and colored fish. , Finally, relish the stunning views of the Hurghada marina before heading back. Your experience ends with a drop-off at your hotel in Hurghada.

description: Discover Cairo on a day trip by bus from Hurghada. Get on the bus at your hotel and enjoy the ride to Cairo in an air-conditioned bus, driving along a beautiful stretch by the Red Sea and through the imposing desert. , ,Your tour guide will be waiting for you in the Egyptian capital and will take you through Cairo in a small group. Visit the Egyptian National Museum, one of the largest museums in the world. Admire the pharaonic treasures including burial objects, coins, clothing, and jewelry. See the golden treasure of Tutankhamen and fascinating sarcophagi. , ,Enjoy lunch at an excellent restaurant before continuing the tour. Visit the famous pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, which include the pyramids of Cheops, Cephren, and Mykerinos. Experience the fantastic view from the plateau before visiting the popular Sphinx.

description: Benefit from pick-up at your hotel, and then journey by air-conditioned vehicle to Abu Dabab Beach. Located some 31 kilometers south of Marsa Alam Airport, Abu Dabab is one of the most popular bays in the Marsa Alam area. Also known as  Turtles Bay,  the beach is said to be the prettiest along the entire coast. , ,Marvel at its clean and sandy beach, and collect your snorkeling equipment to venture into the sea. Your snorkeling guide will give you time to relax and change before your first snorkel adventure, either at the coral reefs to the north or south of the aqua center. Get some time at leisure to relax before your second snorkeling session, with the aim of seeing the green turtles and dugongs (sea cows) that normally frequent the middle of the bay. , ,Along the way, admire the colorful and well-maintained coral reefs, and look for all kinds of marine life that live around the underwater gardens. Benefit from easy access to the water direct from the beach, making it a perfect snorkeling adventure for children and the less experienced. , ,Get some more free time to check out the beach bar, before you journey back to your hotel at around 13:00.

description: Discover the fantastic underwater world of Paradise Island. After the pick-up at your hotel you will be driven to the pier, from where you will cruise approximately 1 hour to Paradise Island. Along the way you can enjoy numerous short opportunities for snorkeling. , ,The paradise beach is part of Giftun Island National Park near Hurghada. The island is perfect for those seeking tranquility. Paradise Island has a beautiful sandy beach and offers the opportunity to spend your time as you wish. Enjoy the sunshine on the beach or enjoy swimming and snorkeling along the coast. Even in the shallow water you can see a unique variety of fish. , ,Onboard the boat you can enjoy a delicious lunch. You will then return to the pier in Hurghada in the afternoon and transfer back to your hotel.

description: Discover Cairo on this 2-day tour including accommodation and flights form Hurghada. You will be picked up at your hotel in the morning and driven by air-conditioned vehicle to the airport. Upon arrival in Cairo you will be met by your tour guide. , First you will visit the Egyptian Museum. During the visit your guide will answer all your questions about the exhibits. Afterwards you can enjoy a traditional Egyptian lunch and visit Alabaster Mosque, a landmark of Cairo. , ,At Khan el-Khalili bazaar, the largest bazaar in the Arab world, you will encounter people of all social classes and religions. Spend an hour browsing through the bazaar before heading to your hotel in Cairo. After check-in at the hotel, you will have some time to rest and prepare for the night in Cairo. Spend the evening as you wish or book a fantastic sound and light show at the pyramids. , ,The next morning you will be picked up at your hotel at 09:00 and driven to the famous pyramids and the Sphinx. Here you will have three hours to admire these fantastic ancient structures. Afterwards you will head towards Saqqara, where you can enjoy a delicious lunch before visiting the step pyramid of Saqqara. , ,In the afternoon you will leave Cairo and return to Hurghada. You will be transferred to the airport in Cairo, where you will say goodbye to your tour guide. A driver will be waiting for you in Hurghada to take you back to your hotel.

description: Explore the sights of Luxor and immerse yourself in the history of the Valley of the Kings. After pick-up at your hotel, drive to the final resting place of the pharaohs and learn all about the last journey of the ancient Egyptian kings. , ,Visit the gigantic twin statues of the Colossi of Memnon, built to protect the necropolis, and the impressive Temple of Queen Hatshepsut. Find out more about the 3-tiered mortuary temple located under a 90-meter cliff. , ,After a hearty lunch at a local restaurant, head to the impressive Karnak Temple and admire the soaring pillars, chapels, and statues before setting off on the return journey to your hotel.

Depart for the park at 09:00 or 10:00 to make the most of the day. Then, on arrival, take an adrenaline-pumping ride down one of the high-speed water slides, or float your cares away on the lazy river.  , ,When you get hungry, a selection of on-site restaurants and a supermarket are there to satisfy your cravings, The park also offers plenty of picnic tables and food areas for your convenience.

description: Day 1: Pyramids of Giza and the Egyptian Museum , ,You will be met in your hotel by your guide and picked up by an air-conditioned van. Start your day by visiting the Egyptian Museum. You will get to see 165,000 Egyptian artifacts. The priceless treasures of King Tutankhamen are the highlight here. His six gilded coffins dominate the main hall, while his magnificent death mask is the star attraction. You can also visit the Mummies Hall (additional cost). Next, enjoy sailing along the Nile on a small boat and watch the sites of the city (optional). , ,You will have your lunch in a restaurant located by the river Nile. Next stop on your tour is the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx, one of the Seven Wonders of the World and still a riddle today. A truly unforgettable experience, the Sphinx is an enigmatic symbol of Egypt. You will have free time to enter one of the pyramids (additional cost) if you wish. You will also have a chance to do some shopping and visit a perfume factory and traditional Papyrus Institute, where you can see how they make papyrus and purchase a unique gift. Then, drive back to your hotel. , ,Day 2: Islamic and Coptic Cairo  , ,Have amazing day trip to old Islamic and Coptic Cairo, where you will walk in the oldest streets between ancient Islamic and Coptic monuments. You will be picked up by your guide to visit the Hanging Church (named for its location above a gatehouse of the Babylon Fortress.) Then, you will visit the Coptic Museum with the largest collection of Egyptian Christian artifacts in the world. Near by the Coptic Museum you will find located Ben Ezra Synagogue. This was the synagogue whose geniza or store room was found in the 19th century to contain a treasure of abandoned Hebrew. Next, you will visit the Citadel of Saladin which is a fortification in Cairo. You will then have lunch followed by a walk through Khan El Khalili Street. You could ask yourself how a market in Egypt is responsible for the founding of the United States. This is an experience you will find unforgettable. Return back to your hotel.
includes: Entrance fee to the mentioned sites in the program ,Private Egyptologist tour guide for 2-days ,Private transfer for 2-days ,Pick-up and drop-off ,Lunch for 2-days

title: Cairo: Private 2-Day Tour

description: Your driver will pick you up directly from your hotel in Marsa Alam and drive you to Luxor in an air-conditioned car before you'll meet your qualified Egyptologist guide. Your tour includes lunch at a local Egyptian restaurant. , ,Make a stop at the two Colossi of Memnon, huge stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III. After you have taken some photos, you will visit the Valley of the Queens, considered the home of the women and children of the pharaohs. In addition to many queens, there are also numerous tombs of princes and princesses. Here, you can also visit the famous tomb of Queen Nefertari (Optional), one of the most famous queens of ancient times. , ,Saving the best for last, your tour will end with a visit to Medinet Habu Temple. Visit the Ramesseum Temple to explore the mortuary, built by Pharaoh Ramesses II. Admire the intricate carved reliefs depicting battles and festival scenes. At the end of your tour, the driver will transfer you back to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

Enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Visit the Great Sphinx, and the Valley Temple, where the king was mummified and purified before his burial. description: Bedouin people are excellent hosts and are well known for looking after guests and making them feel welcome. This is part of a tradition that has been passed down generation after generation.  Firstly there is the famous Bedouin tea, made from tea leaf with sugar, and desert herbs of habuck and marmaraya. , ,The second part of the hospitality always involves food, Bedouin people will always make sure their guest are well refreshed with tea, water and traditional Bedouin food. This includes delicious Bedouin bread cooked on an open fire, rice and either a meat, fish or vegetable dish. The cooking is always from fresh produce grown or reared locally. They take much pride in their cooking and food is always seen as a special event. ,Itinerary: , ,Leaving Dahab at 05.30 pm and drive the car for 20 min. Then we'll ride the camel in the desert for 45 min towards the mountains to enjoy a Bedouin style BBQ. We'll arrive before sunset. , ,Observe the millions of stars in the clear night sky in this heavenly, tranquil place. , ,A drive back to the hotel will see you back at your hotel for around 10.00 p.m or choose to stay overnight a in Bedouin camp and drive back next day by car at 08:00 AM.
includes: Bedouin tea and soft drinks ,Experienced guide, ,Transportation by jeeps and camels (1 camel for 1 person) Food

description: Start your day with pick up at your hotel and a drive to the tour motor park. There, you'll take a training crash course on Quad driving, where you ll receive all of the information necessary for this excursion. Then it will be time to start your exhilarating drive through the Dry Canyon, an approximately 40 kilometer round trip. , ,During the tour there will be three main stops. First, stop at a Bedouin camp, where you'll be served a complimentary drink and shisha by some local Bedouins. The second stop will be Wadi Billy, or Dry Canyon. This canyon was covered by the Red Sea waters millions of years ago. Here you'll enjoy the beautiful views of the canyon and see the fossils of ancient corals and shells. Your final stop will be at the top of Wadi Billy - here you will be almost 150 meters above sea level, granting you a stunning view into the canyon.  ,Enjoy a final ride with the Quad bike through the desert before heading back to the motor park.

description: This 4-hour sightseeing tour explores the mysteries of the Great Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx in the Giza Plateau. The oldest and last remaining of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, the site is not only the most popular attraction in Egypt, it s one of the most loved destinations in the world. , ,In the company of an expert Egyptologist guide, you will visit the Pyramid of Cheops, the middle Pyramid of Chephren, and the small Pyramid of Mykerinos. Continue to the Great Sphinx with its head of a man and body of a lion, gazing imposingly across the valley. , ,Then, complete your tour of the pyramid complex with a walk through the Valley Temple, learning more about the site s astonishing creation and construction back in 2560 2540 BC.
includes: Egyptologist guide ,Transportation ,Entrance fees ,Parking ,Taxes ,Service charge

title: Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx Half-Day Tour

description: Get ready, get set, for an experience of a lifetim  a half-day trip to the Great Pyramids of Giza!                , ,The Giza Plateau is a formation of three pyramids, where a father, son, and grandson constructed their afterlife tombs and mapped their journeys to the afterlife. It s still a bit of a mystery as to how the pyramids were constructed and how long they took to complete, but there s no question that the pyramids still represent the pinnacle of ancient Egyptian architectural accomplishments. The whole area, really, continues to hold many secrets yet to be uncovered, making the pyramids one of the most alluring and inviting places in the world.  , ,Why not tick off that bucket list item, and then some, with a half-day tour to the pyramids that s going to prove to you why everyone reveres this site so much. What sets this Pyramids tour apart from the others is that you'll beat the tourists and arrive at the Giza Plateau well before the crowds and that ruthless midday sun. You'll also be treated to a local lunch! Pyramids, Sphinx, and lunch? Oh my!  , ,The day starts by seeing the guardian of the necropolis, the Sphinx (you know, the one with the missing nose!), which stands in front of the second Pyramid of Khepren. Enter the Giza Plateau from the Sphinx Gate to beat the crowds to the site, and after seeing the Sphinx, walk to the mysterious great pyramid of King Cheops, where you can marvel at the sheer size of the construction, and try and formulate your own theories as to how it was built.  , ,The Pyramids tour continues to the second Pyramid of Giza, which is the second largest and the only pyramid that still caries part of its original casing. From there, continue to the third and the smallest of the Giza Plateau pyramids. And no visit to the Pyramids of Giza would be complete without stopping at the panoramic view point where you get to see the all the pyramids of Giza in the one spot (and take a photo like the ones you see in travel books   free of tourists! Well, almost )  , ,Leaving the amazing pyramids behinds, head back out to the streets of Cairo and stop by a local restaurant for lunch. You'll be treated to Koshary, a dish of rice, pasta, lentils, fried onions, and chili sauce, and a favorite amongst young local Egyptians. After lunch, you'll be dropped back off at one of the starting points, where you can carry on your day (although the Pyramids are sure to have already been the highlight!).
includes: Local English-speaking guide ,Pyramids area entrance fees ,Koshary lunch
experiences: Visit the iconic Pyramids of Giza before the crowds and the heat ,Snap those photos you ve always wanted, without pesky tourists getting in the way ,Marvel at one of the true ancient masterpieces: the Sphinx and his Pyramids ,Indulge in a local lunch, making this tour of the Pyramids just a little bit different than the rest
title: Great Pyramids of Giza Half-Day Adventure

description: Your tour begins with an easy hotel pickup, where your guide will be awaiting you in your hotel lobby. Get an up close look at the Great Sphinx, and visit the Valley Temple on the site where the ancient pharaohs were laid to rest. This is a family friendly tour, so kids are welcome! , ,Take a camel ride through the desert and feel just like an ancient Egyptian. This is truly an unforgettable experience! , ,Next, take a history tour of Cairo, which will take you along all the lesser known but must-see local spots. Take in the panoramic views of the Pyramids and the Sphinx, make an optional stop at Taverna's for local Cairo food, and visit the Egyptian Museum to see Egypt's hidden treasures. The city has a rich local history, ranging from the ancients to modern time. Learn about what is going on in Cairo today! Meet the locals, who will show you how to make the most of your trip. , ,At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.

You will have free time to have your own tour and visit the Mummy room if you are interested.Your tour will continue to Giza to have lunch in a local restaurant before take you to the stunning Pyramids of Giza. description: Enjoy a full day exploring Cairo on this sighting tour. You will visit the Egyptian Museum, where you can see the Treasures of King Tutankamoun before visiting the Citadel where you see the famous Mosque of Mohamed Ali and then visit Khan Khalili Bazaar. The tour could be sharing with others if there other guests booked it on same date
title: Cairo with Egyptian Museum and Khan Khalili Bazaar Day Tour

description: Combine adventure with dramatic desert scenery, as you take to the sands on a quad bike, using the sunset against the Sinai mountains as your backdrop.
title: Quad Biking in the Egyptian Desert from Hurghada

description: Combine a morning in Dendara where you can visit the Temple of Hathor, before continuing for an afternoon of sightseeing in Abydos, home to The Cult of Osiris . It is a place where most ancient Egyptians would have made a pilgrimage to at least once in their lifetime.
title: Private Tour: Dendara and Abydos

description: If you have a limited time in Egypt and would like to explore the highlights of Luxor City in one day this is the best option.You will be picked up from your hotel by your driver at 4am. He will take you to the domestic airport for your flight to Luxor.Arriving in Luxor, you will be met at the airport by your tour guide (holding a sign with your name on it). In a modern, air-conditioned vehicle he will transfer you to the different sights. Enjoy an excursion to the Necropolis of Thebes, on the Eastern bank of the river.
title: Day Trip to Luxor from Cairo by Plane with Lunch

description: See the sun rise over the desert on an unforgettable visit to the place where Moses received the 10 Commandments. You'll travel in air-conditioned comfort with your own personal Egyptologist guide, who will accompany you up Moses' Mountain and take you on a tour of St. Catherine's Monastery.
title: Mt Sinai, St Catherine's Monastery Private with Sunrise Hike

description: The best way to find your bearings when arriving in a new city is to take a city tour. This three-hour trip with your own private guide is the perfect way to see the sights of Hurghada including the Big Mosque, St Mary Church, the port area and of course free time for shopping in the bazaars.
title: Private Tour: Hurghada City Sightseeing

description: Your driver will pick you up from your hotel at 4pm to take you to the Cairo pier. Get on a traditional Egyptian boat known as Felucca and enjoy a relaxing one-hour sail along the River Nile. Let the evening sun shine in your face and enjoy the fantastic views of the city while having soft drinks and snacks. Your driver will wait at the pier to take you back to your hotel after the cruise has finished.
title: River Nile Felucca Sunset Sail 1-Hour Evening Tour in Cairo

description: A one-hour drive by jeep through the desert brings you to the starting point of your tour. After an easy 30-minute walk up a small hill you will be met by your Bedouin hosts and introduced to their way of life.Settle in for the evening and gaze upon the spectacular desert sunset as you feast on a Bedouin BBQ dinner, before returning to your Hurghada hotel.
title: Bedouin BBQ in the Egyptian Desert by 4x4

description: Start your full day tour visiting the Highlights of Luxor City where you visit valley of the Kings, the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut, also known as El Dir El Bahari and Colossi Of Memnon. Lunch is included and then continue to the East Bank where you Visit Luxor and Karnak Temples. At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your Hotel, Nile Cruise or to Luxor airport.
title: Full Day Tour to East and West Banks of Luxor

description: Can you truly say you have been to Egypt if you haven't ridden a camel? Find out for yourself on an afternoon Camel Safari through the desert, and finish the day with an authentic taste of Bedouin tea. You also have the option of dining on a Bedouin dinner including the unique bread.
title: Camel Safari with Optional Bedouin Dinner

description: Immerse yourself in the bustle and beauty of downtown Cairo on this fascinating 4-hour walking tour. Set off in the late afternoon at Zamalek Island to see the off-the-beaten track gems and major landmarks along both old and modern streets of this captivating metropolis. Freshly painted graffiti provides colorful context to Liberation Square (Midan Tahrir), and the grand 19th-century buildings set a perfect backdrop for downtown street theater. Hear fascinating facts and stories from your guide as you walk, and finish with supper at an authentic Egyptian restaurant.
title: Cairo Half-Day Downtown Tour Including Egyptian Dinner

description: Experience the underwater world of the Red Sea without getting wet! Board the Sinbad Submarine for an unforgettable underwater adventure, diving below the Red Sea to enjoy the tranquility of life beneath the waves.
title: Sinbad Submarine Under The Red Sea

description: Visit the famous church of Saint Simon the Tanner, the cave church. The largest church in Cairo located inside El mokkatam mountain in a small village named by zableen means garbage collectors. Inside the church Virgin Mary appeared in carved statue in ceiling without any human effort.
title: Day Trip from Cairo to El Mokkatm Mountain Cave Church

description: If you remember reading about the city of Thebes, an ancient Egyptian city, then you will want to go on Tour to Luxor from Hurghada because Luxor is modern day Thebes and is filled with history dating back hundreds and thousands of years!
title: Tour to Luxor from Hurghada

description: Experience ancient Egypt like never before at the Pharaonic Village in Cairo. A great family-friendly activity during your Egyptian vacation, the Pharaonic Village is a living museum of ancient Egyptian life.
title: Private Tour: Pharaonic Village

description: Travel from Luxor to Dendara either by road in an air conditioned vehicle or by boat along the Nile River to see the well preserved Temple of Hathor, Temple of Isis and Coptic Basilica. Your qualified Egyptologist guide will introduce you to the main features of the complex before allowing you additional free time to explore at leisure.
title: Private Tour: Dendara from Luxor

description: Egypt's Red Sea is home to some of the world's most famous dive sites and Hurghada, on the Red Sea coast, offers some stunning coral gardens just off-shore. This 1-day, 2-dive trip, suitable both for absolute beginners and qualified divers, visits different sites depending on availability, weather conditions, and guests' experience level: lunch is included.
title: Hurghada Daily Scuba Dive Trip

description: The Nile River is considered the longest river in the world. Enjoy one of the most unique experiences on the Nile in Cairo by joining a dinner cruise.From the top-deck take unforgettable pictures of Cairo illuminated sights and land marks, smell the fresh breeze of the Nile that inspired so many writers, poets and lovers in history. The dinner cruise takes you on a journey for 2 hours through Cairo while serving a buffet dinner and offering a live show of exquisite oriental belly dance and mystical whirling Dervish, Sufi dance or Tannoura
title: Nile River Dinner Cruise with Cultural Show, Private Transfers
